projects.name: Sup
projects.blurb: Location-based, privacy- and simplicity-oriented social network that allows users to temporarily share their current location to a subset of followers. Comprised of an API webserver and separate iOS client. Built with Node.js, Express, and Objecive-C. Developed during Software Design class at Macalester College, Spring 2014.

education.name: IES Madrid
details: Semester-long study abroad program in Madrid

work.blurb: Design, build, deploy, and maintain websites for clients, from mock-ups to analytics.

projects.name: Will Matsuda
projects.blurb: Portfolio website that uses the Tumblr API to download and sort photos according to tags specified through a custom admin panel. Built with Node.js and Express.

projects.name: Guilt Trip Management
projects.blurb: Simple static website for Minneapolis-based artist booking and management company.

work.title: Web Director, General Manager
work.blurb: As Web Director (2012-2015), had sole responsibility for updating, designing, and maintaining the station's website. As General Manager (Fall 2014), had the additional repsonsibility of managing the station's budget, overseeing a half-dozen managers as well as a staff of over a hundred.

projects.name: WMCN.fm
projects.blurb: Webapp for Macalesterâ€™s radio station. Features an admin panel for approving show applications, scheduling shows, and managing user privileges. Also features a custom CMS for DJs to post show playlists. Built with Node.js and Express.

projects.name: WMCN API
projects.blurb: Standalone API layer for WMCN's PostgreSQL database, developed to allow subsequent developers to build separate iOS, Android, or web interfaces for the station. Built with Node.js and Express.

work.company: Macalester College Media & Cultural Studies Department
work.title: Research Assistant
work.blurb: Collaborated with Professor John Kim over the course of two summers to develop a Max/MSP-based sound installation that was exhibited at Macalester College during Fall 2014. Awarded a Wallace Summer Research Grant for summer 2014.

projects.name: Timelaps
projects.blurb: Sound installation that represents current weather conditions at Lake Superior, MN in the form of ambient music. Comprised of a Python application that mines realtime weather data from NOAA and a Max/MSP program to sonify the data. Developed in collaboration with John Kim as part of a research project from 2013-214. Exhibited at Macalester College, fall 2014.

work.title: Sound Design + Programming Assistant
work.blurb: Collaborated with the lead sound designer to develop a Max/MSP-based sound installation as part of a project that was a finalist for the 2013 Minneapolis Creative City Challenge

projects.name: Lakeforms
projects.blurb: Dynamic, interactive public pavilion that invites residents and visitors into the Minneapolis Convention Center plaza to relax, explore, and learn about Minneapolis's urban lakes. The pavilion's physical structure is a digitally enhanced scale model of the lakes' underwater topogrpahy. Inside the structure, visitors can engage with ambient music derived from realtime weather data collected across Minneapolis' urban lakes.

work.title: New Media Initiatives Intern
work.blurb: Used Instagram, Leaflet, Stripe, Flickr, and Facebook APIs to add various features to the Walker's award-winning website.

work.title: Concerts & Festivals Co-chair
work.blurb: Selected to a small student committee responsible for planning most of the college's large-scale student events for the year. Served as co-chair of an independent concert-planning subcommittee with a total budget of about $60,000

work.title: Gallery Intern
work.blurb: Worked closely with the center's director to plan and build a new cinema room and the summer 2012 exhibition space

work.title: Vice-President, Founding Board Member
work.blurb: Helped start a student-run, 501(c)(3)-accredited nonprofit to raise money for Portland Public Schools music programs by hosting monthly student concerts and annual benefit shows

job.title: Assistant Professor of Media and Cultural Studies
